meanings.definition: An ion that is attracted to an oppositely charged ion in a solution.
meanings.sent1: The counterion moved towards the positively charged ion in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: In the solution, the counterion balanced the charge of the opposite ion.
meanings.sent3: The counterion and its charged partner danced together in the liquid.
meanings.sent4: Like a magnet, the counterion was drawn to its oppositely charged companion.
meanings.sent5: The counterion eagerly sought out its opposite to create balance in the solution.

meanings.definition: A charged particle that balances the charge of another ion.
meanings.sent1: Adding the counterion neutralized the charge of the ion in the mixture.
meanings.sent2: The counterion helped stabilize the overall charge of the solution.
meanings.sent3: The counterion played the role of the charge balancer in the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent4: The counterion acted like a guardian, ensuring the charge equilibrium of the system.
meanings.sent5: With precision, the counterion matched the charge of its ion partner, maintaining harmony.
